title: [QUESTION] Can we set the canvas size/resolution of an SKCanvasView
body:
I've been hunting around for an answer to this directly but can't find anything other than people setting SKBitmaps with a Width/Height and then making an SKCanvas from that.

I'm talking specifically with the SKCanvasView.

For example, I have an SKCanvasView that basically fills most of the screen, on this I'm drawing a bunch of lines, text and circles (think schematic drawing) that can be scaled, rotated and moved with gestures (using SkiaScene plugin).

This runs super smooth on iphones (with a Canvas size of 750x1086, seems 60fps on a 6) but on my ipad mini 4 its a bit laggy (Canvas size of 2048x1276 and maybe as low as 15/20fps)

I'm *guessing* its the increased canvas size causing the issue, I'd at least like to try to narrow that down by trying out a smaller canvas size but stretched to fill the screen. Is that possible?

Can I set the SKCanvasView to fill screen, but say have an internal canvas of 1024x638 (same aspect ratio, but quarter the resolution)?

I understand too that my paint widths and text sizes would appear bigger on screen, but I already have a dynamic text size/paint scaling for different canvas sizes to produce 'similar' results...
